ConfigItem.Desc: Pio mask.
In addition to the Logical Input mask stimuli, the VREG enable signal can be configured as a stimulus for the mapped System or User event.
In addition to the Logical Input mask stimuli, the Charger detect signal can be configured as a stimulus for the mapped System or User event.
State mask.
Specifies the duration for which the selected Logical Input must be asserted in order to generate the mapped System or User Event.
The time interval, in ms, in which a second press may be detected leading to a double press event instead of reporting the button press as a single press.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a long timer message.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very long timer message.
The time, in ms, between repeat messages being generated if a button is held down.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very very long timer message.
The number of debounce checks performed.
The interval between each debounce check in ms.
The number of debounce checks performed.
The interval between each debounce check in ms.
(internal) button number to assign, 0 to 15
physical input
The User Event that will be originated when the mapped sequence of logical inputs is asserted in the correct order. N/A terminates the sequence.

ConfigArray.Desc: Select the logical input which the user shall assert at the sequence stage

ConfigItem.Desc: Makes the Sink connectable on a button press. This is used with multipoint operation in the situation where one Sink is already connected and the user wishes to connect a second Sink and needs to make the Sink connectable to do so.
When using multipoint operation it is possible to use two different events for triggering a last number redial on Audio Gateways AG1 or AG2.
When using multipoint operation it is possible to use two different events for triggering a voice dial operation on Audio Gateways AG1 or AG2.

ConfigItem.Id: Ignore Button Event if Enabling LEDs
ConfigItem.Desc: When set this prevents a button from raising an event, but only when LEDs are being re-activated. It merely re-enables the display of LEDs (when they had previously timed out) but the associated event with the button press will not occur.

StructElementConfigItem.Desc: The time interval, in ms, in which a second press may be detected leading to a double press event instead of reporting the button press as a single press.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a long timer message.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very long timer message.
The time, in ms, between repeat messages being generated if a button is held down.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very very long timer message.
The number of Charger I/O reads performed.
The interval between each Charger I/O read in ms.
The number of PIO reads performed.
The interval between each PIO read in ms.
